text.section: Before a person may dig in or do any other construction on any way in a service area, the person shall obtain from the sanitary commission approval of the digging or construction.

If approval of the plans has been obtained from the sanitary commission, before a person may do any digging or construction different from the approved plans, the person shall:
Submit a new plan that shows the changes in the information required for the original plan; and
Obtain approval from the sanitary commission to do the digging or construction according to the new plan.

If any obstruction has been constructed in, on, or under a way in violation of this section and if the sanitary commission is required to move that obstruction to build or operate a project:
The district may move the obstruction and charge the cost of moving the obstruction to:
The person who constructed or installed the obstruction; or
Any successor in interest to that person;
The owner of the obstruction is not entitled to compensation under this subtitle for moving the obstruction; and
The district is not liable for damage done to the obstruction.

Before beginning work on the plumbing system on any property in a service area, a person shall:
Obtain from the district a permit to do the plumbing work;
Pay to the district the permit fee that the sanitary commission requires; and
Allow the sanitary commission to inspect the plumbing work.

Before connecting the plumbing system of any property to a water pipe or sewer pipe operated by the district, a person shall:
Obtain from the district a permit to make the connection; and
Comply with any additional conditions that the sanitary commission requires.
